intro: Diosma patula, commonly known as the broadleaf diosma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Diosma patula thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
